attributes.action: reform rail ticket pricing by charging by the mile only and banning price rises for underperformers.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Train tickets are too complicated and should be charged on a per mile basis only for all tickets at all times.  

Operators should be restricted to charging users a maximum of 4 pence a mile each way with no minimum.  A London to Edinburgh ticket would therefore be £41.84 return maximum, Leeds to Bristol £16.48 return maximum etc.  

Airlines should be allowed to subsidise airport bound passengers.  It will reduce car pollution.  

Operators should be granted national franchises.  They could then compete directly against one another on the same routes to encourage cleanliness and punctuality.

Rail operators should be allowed 1 price rise a year, controlled by the government.
